definition[0]: coded information uses a system of words, letters, or symbols instead of ordinary writing so that it can only be understood by someone else who knows the system
example[0]: He sent a coded message to CIA headquarters.
definition[1]: having a set of numbers, letters, or symbols to show what something is or give information about it
example[1]: The wires are colour coded for easy identification.
definition[2]: coded language expresses your opinion in an indirect way because it will probably offend someone
example[2]: They voiced their criticism in coded statements.
definition[3]: coded sounds or signals can only be understood by special machines
example[3]: coded signals broadcast by the BBC radio transmitters
